metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10003 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect HTTP Request header comparison in Squid HTTP Proxy 3.5.0.1 through 3.5.22, and 4.0.1 through 4.0.16 results in Collapsed Forwarding feature mistakenly identifying some private responses as being suitable for delivery to multiple clients.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10003` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.3
squid-cgi - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.3
squid-common - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.3
squid-purge - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.3
squid3 - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.3
squidclient - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.12-1ubuntu7.3').
